root.para: Controls may also be established that require traders to identify whether a complex financial instrument may have unique features (for example, embedded derivatives). In such circumstances, there may be a separate function that evaluates complex financial instrument transactions at their initiation (which may be known as a product control group) working in connection with an accounting policy group to ensure that the transaction is accurately recorded. Although smaller entities may not have product control groups, an entity may have a process in place relating to the review of complex financial instrument contracts at the point of origination in order to ensure that they are accounted for appropriately in accordance with the applicable financial reporting framework.
